title: Comcast’s Broadband Growth Slows While Pandemic-Hit NBCUniversal Rebounds
sub_head: Streaming service Peacock had 24.5 million monthly active accounts at end of 2021
body:
Comcast Corp. said it added fewer broadband customers than in recent quarters, a slowdown that comes after a period of record growth during the height of the coronavirus lockdowns.
The Philadelphia-based company, owner of Xfinity-branded broadband and cable services, the NBCUniversal media empire and the U.K.’s Sky TV business, reported a 9.6% decline in fourth-quarter net profit to $3.06 billion, or 66 cents a share, from $3.38 billion, or 73 cents a share, a year earlier.
